title.narrative: CONFLICT-AFFECTED POPULATIONS BENEFIT FROM COMMUNITY-ORIENTED Water, Sanitation, and Hygiene (WASH) INTERVENTIONS

description.narrative: Humanitarian needs of conflict-affected populations are met through community-oriented water, sanitation and hygiene response., which contributes to Evaluation And Research, Sanitation, Sanitation (Covid), Water, Water (Covid). UNICEF aims to achieve this through Advocacy And Public Engagement, Developing And Leveraging Resources And Partnerships, Evaluations, Research And Data, Fostering Innovation And Use Of New Technologies, Operational Support To Programme Delivery, Systems Strengthening And Institution Building. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: By 2022, all children in conflict-affected settings have access to safe drinking water and reduced exposure to any environmental risks.

related-activity.ref: 4410/A0/05/885 ACCESS TO SAFE DRINKING WATER AND REDUCED EXPOSURE TO ANY ENVIRONMENTAL RISKS

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: Humanitarian needs of conflict-affected populations are met through community-oriented water, sanitation and hygiene response.

description.narrative: While responding to the humanitarian crisis in NGCA and along the contact line in GCA, UNICEF strengthened communities' resilience by ensuring uninterrupted water provision at community level and upgrading standards in institutions. UNICEF also contributed to data collection on the most vulnerable children and families in eastern Ukraine. UNICEF advocated in many occasions in this now-protracted conflict, with recurrent induced localized humanitarian situations, to prevent WASH facilities to be targeted by armed groups; but also, to avoid water supply disruption as a collateral damage generated by the central government decisions on the legislative front | Status:On-track | As-of Date:20/01/2020
